POOF.content: difference btwn talking to them [o my friends/enemies] & speaking of them [there are no friends/enemies]: world of difference, fort/da, record their absence after having called ——the contretemps [appealing to other presupposes his presence, allows him to come, while distancing/retarding his arrival] dictates, as insane as it is inevitable, the teleiopoetic sentence > expectation of Messiah as unbearable terror: hatred of what is thus awaited?
POOF.linkedContent: difference btwn talking to them [o my friends/enemies] & speaking of them [there are no friends/enemies]: world of difference, fort/da, record their absence after having called ——the contretemps [appealing to other presupposes his presence, allows him to come, while distancing/retarding his arrival] dictates, as insane as it is inevitable, the teleiopoetic sentence > expectation of Messiah as unbearable terror: hatred of what is thus awaited?

S.content: silent play of quotation marks [re: spirit], Anführungsstriche, Anführungszeichen, “the hand calculates very fast,” Anführen, to conduct, dupe, brainwash, silent contrivances, fort/da, what shows or hides changes everything, and when one puts away after exhibiting, this is mise au pas (bringing to heel)
S.linkedContent: silent play of quotation marks [re: spirit], Anführungsstriche, Anführungszeichen, “the hand calculates very fast,” Anführen, to conduct, dupe, brainwash, silent contrivances, fort/da, what shows or hides changes everything, and when one puts away after exhibiting, this is mise au pas (bringing to heel)

ROP.content: hinge (la charnière), place where flesh is laid out as a lure for the falcon > as hinge, an opening & closing, du gond (cardo), pivot; as flesh, a possible simulacrum or lure (fort/da)
ROP.linkedContent: hinge (la charnière), place where flesh is laid out as a lure for the falcon > as hinge, an opening & closing, du gond (cardo), pivot; as flesh, a possible simulacrum or lure (fort/da)

DPi.content: instant of bandages, Christ’s being-there w/out being-there: this Dasein that is not a Da-sein, this Fort/Da-sein of Christ who’s dead but not dead, mort vivant
DPi.linkedContent: instant of bandages, Christ’s being-there w/out being-there: this Dasein that is not a Da-sein, this Fort/Da-sein of Christ who’s dead but not dead, mort vivant

TB.content: translation, as holy growth of languages, announces messianic end, but sign of end only “present” in “knowledge of that distance,” Entfernung, remoteness
TB.linkedContent: translation, as holy growth of languages, announces messianic end, but sign of end only “present” in “knowledge of that distance,” Entfernung, remoteness

TB.content: can know this remoteness, not overcome it: fort/da (experience is translation)
TB.linkedContent: can know this remoteness, not overcome it: fort/da (experience is translation)

REST.content: fort/da: every “step” implies this double movement (peasant woman now in, now out, of the picture), Heidegger’s whole discourse is supported by it [by abyss of fort/da?] ——fort/da not a relation of opposition, each notion offers an eyelet to be traversed by the other, to the figure or the pointure of the other (Heidegger’s playing w/ the bobbin)
REST.linkedContent: fort/da: every “step” implies this double movement (peasant woman now in, now out, of the picture), Heidegger’s whole discourse is supported by it [by abyss of fort/da?] ——fort/da not a relation of opposition, each notion offers an eyelet to be traversed by the other, to the figure or the pointure of the other (Heidegger’s playing w/ the bobbin)

REST.content: fort: da, double eyelet [i.e. colon instead of slash]: how it must be “reknotted/taken up (renouer)” again in writing
REST.linkedContent: fort: da, double eyelet [i.e. colon instead of slash]: how it must be “reknotted/taken up (renouer)” again in writing

REST.content: Da of Dasein (its proximity) lets distance of fort play w/in it
REST.linkedContent: Da of Dasein (its proximity) lets distance of fort play w/in it

REST.content: Van Gogh’s painting could be called Painting [this made you howl w/ laughter, but too bad] or The Shoes or Fort/Da
REST.linkedContent: Van Gogh’s painting could be called Painting [this made you howl w/ laughter, but too bad] or The Shoes or Fort/Da

REST.content: fort, da: la pointure joue de la virgule
REST.linkedContent: fort, da: la pointure joue de la virgule

REST.content: disparate: that which opens up fort: da of shoe size (pointure), possibility of dis-pairing, play of dis/appearing > double, Doppelgänger, not pair (unadaptable to walking [à la marche])
REST.linkedContent: disparate: that which opens up fort: da of shoe size (pointure), possibility of dis-pairing, play of dis/appearing > double, Doppelgänger, not pair (unadaptable to walking [à la marche])

+R.content: what is detached from my signature, da, a piece (morceau) of the other’s name, one of the most obsessive motifs in Glas
+R.linkedContent: what is detached from my signature, da, a piece (morceau) of the other’s name, one of the most obsessive motifs in Glas

SPEC.content: Freud’s avoidance of philosophy [of Nietzsche] (already in place like a counterfeiter) is inevitable (closest avoided in inevitable itself) > that the da be fort even before a judgment of denegation vienne y apposer la spécificité de son sceau
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s avoidance of philosophy [of Nietzsche] (already in place like a counterfeiter) is inevitable (closest avoided in inevitable itself) > that the da be fort even before a judgment of denegation vienne y apposer la spécificité de son sceau

SPEC.content: fort/da: story of the PP (grandfather & pleasure principle)
SPEC.linkedContent: fort/da: story of the PP (grandfather & pleasure principle)

SPEC.content: Freud his own grandson? put PP in question—Freud makes hypothesis of beyond [the PP] come back (revenir) only to dismiss (congédier) it again, that which comes back (revient) hasn’t truly come back (revenu) > only passed by in specter of its presence
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud his own grandson? put PP in question—Freud makes hypothesis of beyond [the PP] come back (revenir) only to dismiss (congédier) it again, that which comes back (revient) hasn’t truly come back (revenu) > only passed by in specter of its presence

SPEC.content: fort/da: argument of spool, not a story, not a myth > to give it a title is to accredit the deposit, the investiture
SPEC.linkedContent: fort/da: argument of spool, not a story, not a myth > to give it a title is to accredit the deposit, the investiture

SPEC.content: Freud had a hard time recognizing himself among his own (les siens) > not unrelated to origin of objectivity (tribunal forbidden to judge the conditions of its establishment)
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud had a hard time recognizing himself among his own (les siens) > not unrelated to origin of objectivity (tribunal forbidden to judge the conditions of its establishment)

SPEC.content: law of oikos, open secret, family vacance (vacancy, vacation), secret for no one [everyone knows Freud is Ernst’s PP], domestico-familial, domestico-funerary
SPEC.linkedContent: law of oikos, open secret, family vacance (vacancy, vacation), secret for no one [everyone knows Freud is Ernst’s PP], domestico-familial, domestico-funerary

SPEC.content: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time

SPEC.content: “[PP, the spool, ça, SA, Ernst, Freud] fait semblant d’eloigner le PP pour le ramener sans cesse, pour constater qu’il se ramène lui-même” [hetero-tautology? bringing it all back home]
SPEC.linkedContent: “[PP, the spool, ça, SA, Ernst, Freud] fait semblant d’eloigner le PP pour le ramener sans cesse, pour constater qu’il se ramène lui-même” [hetero-tautology? bringing it all back home]

SPEC.content: fort/da and Freud’s speculative game: same application
SPEC.linkedContent: fort/da and Freud’s speculative game: same application

SPEC.content: who causes (himself, who) to come back (revenir) in narrating this narrative [Freud? Ernst?]?
SPEC.linkedContent: who causes (himself, who) to come back (revenir) in narrating this narrative [Freud? Ernst?]?

SPEC.content: autobiography of Freud as living description of his own writing, as if grandson were dictating to Freud what he had to set down on paper > not just tautological mirror, autobiography of the writing posits/deposits simultaneously—the psychoanalytic movement, elle performe et parie sur ce qui donna la chance [to psychoanalysis] > now Derrida: “je parie" that this double fort/da cooperates in initiating psychoanalysis
SPEC.linkedContent: autobiography of Freud as living description of his own writing, as if grandson were dictating to Freud what he had to set down on paper > not just tautological mirror, autobiography of the writing posits/deposits simultaneously—the psychoanalytic movement, elle performe et parie sur ce qui donna la chance [to psychoanalysis] > now Derrida: “je parie" that this double fort/da cooperates in initiating psychoanalysis

SPEC.content: en abyme of Freud’s writing [re: autobiography in fort/da narrative] has relation of structural mimesis w/ relation btwn PP & “its” death drive—latter hollows out the former en abyme, at origin of origin
SPEC.linkedContent: en abyme of Freud’s writing [re: autobiography in fort/da narrative] has relation of structural mimesis w/ relation btwn PP & “its” death drive—latter hollows out the former en abyme, at origin of origin

SPEC.content: how can [Freud’s] autobiography give a worldwide (mondiale) institution its birth? what is autobiography if everything that follows from it is possible?
SPEC.linkedContent: how can [Freud’s] autobiography give a worldwide (mondiale) institution its birth? what is autobiography if everything that follows from it is possible?

SPEC.content: speculator can survive legatee of an autobiographical speculation, institution of movement w/out limit: mutism/death of legatee, one of the possibilities that dictates/causes legatee to write
SPEC.linkedContent: speculator can survive legatee of an autobiographical speculation, institution of movement w/out limit: mutism/death of legatee, one of the possibilities that dictates/causes legatee to write

SPEC.content: one gives oneself one’s own movement, one inherits from oneself all the time
SPEC.linkedContent: one gives oneself one’s own movement, one inherits from oneself all the time

SPEC.content: sufficient provisions so ghost can always step up to the cashier (passer à la caisse); all that’s necessary is to pronounce a name guaranteeing a signature, one thinks
SPEC.linkedContent: sufficient provisions so ghost can always step up to the cashier (passer à la caisse); all that’s necessary is to pronounce a name guaranteeing a signature, one thinks

SPEC.content: to control everything, he has to act w/ dispatch (il se dépêche), Freud stages peremptory authoritarianism, unexplained decisions, unanswered questions
SPEC.linkedContent: to control everything, he has to act w/ dispatch (il se dépêche), Freud stages peremptory authoritarianism, unexplained decisions, unanswered questions

SPEC.content: Ernst will have to pay himself w/ bad habit [fort/da] for his good habit [not crying when mother is gone]
SPEC.linkedContent: Ernst will have to pay himself w/ bad habit [fort/da] for his good habit [not crying when mother is gone]

SPEC.content: for Freud, work consists in rassembler, searching in order to bring together, reuniting in order to give back (pour rendre) > play is dispersion that sends far away > fort/da is “a game (un jeu)”: reassemble the reassembling & dispersion, give & take back by oneself [work & play ?]
SPEC.linkedContent: for Freud, work consists in rassembler, searching in order to bring together, reuniting in order to give back (pour rendre) > play is dispersion that sends far away > fort/da is “a game (un jeu)”: reassemble the reassembling & dispersion, give & take back by oneself [work & play ?]

SPEC.content: collective unity [of toys] is apparatus of game that can dislocate itself > word for things in this theory of set is Zeug, which is also penis: supplementary complex that can reassemble parents
SPEC.linkedContent: collective unity [of toys] is apparatus of game that can dislocate itself > word for things in this theory of set is Zeug, which is also penis: supplementary complex that can reassemble parents

SPEC.content: proper noun beneath all this [Freud family]
SPEC.linkedContent: proper noun beneath all this [Freud family]

SPEC.content: [grandson & son want each other to understand] but we know what a tautology can bring back by gushing over (peut faire revenir en dégorgeant)
SPEC.linkedContent: [grandson & son want each other to understand] but we know what a tautology can bring back by gushing over (peut faire revenir en dégorgeant)

SPEC.content: disappearance & return (Verschwinden und Wiederkommen)
SPEC.linkedContent: disappearance & return (Verschwinden und Wiederkommen)

SPEC.content: because speculator is a motivated observer, completion could never be declared by him > also, there’s a structure of incompletion in scene of writing: unconscious binds (lie) one to other [scene described & description], telecommunicated acc. same teleology
SPEC.linkedContent: because speculator is a motivated observer, completion could never be declared by him > also, there’s a structure of incompletion in scene of writing: unconscious binds (lie) one to other [scene described & description], telecommunicated acc. same teleology

SPEC.content: for Freud, in game of fort/da, the greatest pleasure is the re-turn (re-venir), Wiederkommen: yet, again becoming revenant, [spool] must be thrown away again > [Freud, the game] speculates on the return (retour): au départ de ce qui se doit de revenir
SPEC.linkedContent: for Freud, in game of fort/da, the greatest pleasure is the re-turn (re-venir), Wiederkommen: yet, again becoming revenant, [spool] must be thrown away again > [Freud, the game] speculates on the return (retour): au départ de ce qui se doit de revenir

SPEC.content: Eisenbahn, Freud’s phobia of trains, he would have expected Ernst to play choo-choo
SPEC.linkedContent: Eisenbahn, Freud’s phobia of trains, he would have expected Ernst to play choo-choo

SPEC.content: “car la chose est un véhicule en translation (for the thing is a vehicle in convoy)”
SPEC.linkedContent: “car la chose est un véhicule en translation (for the thing is a vehicle in convoy)”

SPEC.content: bed too serious, fort, but not fort enough, Freud wanted Ernst to play away from bed [?]
SPEC.linkedContent: bed too serious, fort, but not fort enough, Freud wanted Ernst to play away from bed [?]

SPEC.content: Ernst doesn’t have la chose before him [fort/da], like it’s before Eurydice or the analyst

SPEC.content: analysand-locomotive (speculator/analyst the 1st analysand): for whom law of listening substituted for law of looking
SPEC.linkedContent: analysand-locomotive (speculator/analyst the 1st analysand): for whom law of listening substituted for law of looking

SPEC.content: curtains, veils, “skirt” of bed, hymen of fort:da, edge of bed (lit) [of reading?], va-et-vient, there would’ve been a hymen even w/out curtains > veil of this “skirt” is interest of bed (lit) and fort:da of all these generations

SPEC.content: [Derrida clearly explains the difference btwn fort/da and fort:da] “skirt” of bed, which hides the bars, forms inner chamber of fort/da, double screen which divides w/in itself—but dividing only by reassembling it w/ itself, sticking (piquant) to itself doubly, fort:da

SPEC.content: what binds (lie) game to itself is re- of return, the returned or the returning (le revenu ou le revenant), revenance orders entire teleology, can be handed over to PP
SPEC.linkedContent: what binds (lie) game to itself is re- of return, the returned or the returning (le revenu ou le revenant), revenance orders entire teleology, can be handed over to PP

SPEC.content: mastery of PP [grand (-père) spéculateur] as mastery in general, Herrschaft distanced from PP only to reappropriate itself: tauto-teleology makes other return in its domestic specter

SPEC.linkedContent: reappearance as a moment of the couple disappearance/reappearance, return to itself of return: greatest pleasure

SPEC.content: force of disappearance, of “fort” > capitalized pleasure (plaisir) (idealization) does w/out what it needs: one provides oneself w/ head of what one needs by doing w/out it (to have it)

SPEC.linkedContent: fort/da: scene of writing that Freud’s playing, plays itself, plays him

SPEC.content: incomplete in its 2 pieces, thus completely incomplete, multiplying, supplementing
SPEC.linkedContent: incomplete in its 2 pieces, thus completely incomplete, multiplying, supplementing

SPEC.linkedContent: detour of the télé, an entire chaine (network)

SPEC.content: [Freud’s speculation on Ernst] needs no witness, no counter-testimony has weight before this teleological auto-institution
SPEC.linkedContent: [Freud’s speculation on Ernst] needs no witness, no counter-testimony has weight before this teleological auto-institution

SPEC.content: net (filet) is in place, one pulls on a string (fil), getting a hand, foot, caught: c’est un lasso ou un lacet > Freud caught himself in advance; rapporté différé (deferred overlapping) > describing in advance scene of its own description

SPEC.content: an abyss of more than one generation [Freud & Ernst] (also said about computers), an a priori of an aftereffect (d’un après-coup) [Derrida doing this too?] > formal structure se donne à lire once objects can substitute for each other (laying bare substitutive structure itself)

SPEC.content: specularity not simply reappropriation
SPEC.linkedContent: specularity not simply reappropriation

SPEC.content: speculator describes what he’s doing w/out doing so explicitly [Rousseau from OG], does w/out auto-analytic calculation, w/out calculation itself analyzing itself > thus the interest and necessity of the thing [for Freud? for Derrida?]
